description: The course introduces students to the religious traditions of India through lectures, readings, discussions, and excursions, including interaction with leaders of religious communities. Indian religious scholars and practitioners provide background for understanding the history, beliefs, and practices of major religious traditions of India, including Hinduism, Islam, and Christianity, and Indian perspectives on religious pluralism and interfaith relations. Counts toward Asian studies major and concentration. Offered periodically during Interim. Prerequisite: completion of BTS-B.
name: Religions of India
notes: You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
